HomeText1: With Track Your Stress you can track your individual stress-level with modern smart phone applications. You can systematically track the variation of your stress-level and find out the factors associated with your stress-level.
HomeText2: Register an account and fill in some short questionnaires for statistic reasons.
HomeText3: Download the App for iPhone or iPod touch on the Apple App Store or for Android on the Google Play Store.
HomeText4: Start tracking your stress-level and see realtime charts right on your smartphone.

About1: Stress is the response of the organism to any demand. Different individuals can show different stress responses to one and the same demand. Moreover, one individual can show a different stress response to one and the same demand in different situations / contexts. The stress response due to the demand depends for example on the coping strategies of the individual.
About2: With this research project we want to offer a method to track the individual stress and coping with a smart phone application. Using the website in conjunction with your phone you can systematically track these variations and find out how they are associated with your daily life. Your answers will also help us learn to more about the variation of stress and coping.
Privacy1: We recognize that the service offered by TrackYourStress works with very sensible personal data. Therefore we use the highest data protection standards to ensure the security and confidentiality of your data.
Privacy2: Your data will be completely anonymized. It will not be possible to infer your identity at any time. We will not ask for your full name, your telephone number, your address or any other contact information. The IP-address of your computer will not be saved and any electronic data interchange via the internet will be SSL encoded.
Privacy4: The scientific results of this research project might be published in scientific journals. In these publications it will not be possible to identify any personal information.
TreatStress: TrackYourStress cannot be used to treat stress
TreatStress1: We would like to emphasize here that TrackYourStress is not a medical device. TrackYourStress is a good tool to measure your stress and to find out under which circumstances it goes up or down.
TreatStress2: A worsening of the stress cannot be expected. However, if you feel that your stress is worsening, we want you to stop using TrackYourStress immediately and please get in contact with your medical doctor or therapist.
AboutTeam1: TrackYourStress is a cooperation between the following individuals and universities:
AboutTeam2: Prof. Dr. Thomas Probst (Department for Psychotherapy and Biopsychosocial Health, Danube-University Krems, Austria)
AboutTeam3: B.Sc. Michael Schrempp (Institute of Databases and Information Systems, University Ulm, Germany)
AboutTeam4: M.Sc. Johannes Schobel (Institute of Databases and Information Systems, University Ulm, Germany)
AboutTeam5: PD Dr. Winfried Schlee (Clinic for Psychiatry and Psychotherapy, University Clinic Regensburg, Germany)
AboutTeam6: Prof. Dr. Berthold Langguth (Clinic for Psychiatry and Psychotherapy, University Clinic Regensburg, Germany)
AboutTeam7: Prof. Dr. Myra Spiliopoulou (Knowledge Management and Discovery Lab, Otto-von-Guericke-University Magdeburg, Germany)
AboutTeam8: Prof. Dr. Manfred Reichert (Institute of Databases and Information Systems, University Ulm, Germany)
AboutTeam9: Dr. Rüdiger Pryss (Institute of Databases and Information Systems, University Ulm, Germany)
AboutTeam10: If you have questions, feedback or suggestions please don't hesitate to contact us under info@trackyourstress.org.
